meanings.definition: The quality or state of being thin.
meanings.sent1: The thinnesses of the paper made it easy to tear.
meanings.sent2: She admired the delicate thinnesses of the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The thinnesses of the ice cream cone made it challenging to eat without making a mess.
meanings.sent4: The thinnesses of the spider's web shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the intricate thinnesses of the flower petals in the painting.

meanings.definition: The thin parts or sections of something.
meanings.sent1: He carefully examined the thinnesses of the branches on the tree.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for slicing the vegetables into thinnesses.
meanings.sent3: The thinnesses of the book's pages made it feel like a breeze flipping through them.
meanings.sent4: The thinnesses of the hair strands glistened under the light.
meanings.sent5: The architect focused on the structural integrity of the thinnesses in the building design.

meanings.sent1: Her dedication to exercise resulted in the gradual thinnesses of her waistline.
meanings.sent2: The doctor monitored the patient's progress in the thinnesses of their body mass.
meanings.sent3: The thinnesses of the plot in the movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: The thinnesses of the fog dissipated as the sun rose higher in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The thinnesses of the paint layers created a beautiful blend of colors on the canvas.
